newsitem.title: UK: Rosebys to buy UK bed retailer, place shrs.
newsitem.headline: Rosebys to buy UK bed retailer, place shrs.

text.p: Britain's Rosebys Plc said on Wednesday it planned to buy bed retailer Bensons and another firm, Vaultdart Ltd, for a maximum of 25 million stg.
Rosebys, a retailer of household textiles, said it planned to fund the acquisition in part with a placing of 1.93 million new ordinary shares at 315 per share.
Under the deal, Rosebys would buy 81 percent of Bensons and all of Vaultdart, which owns the remaining 19 percent of Bensons.
The initial consideration would be 20 million stg, of which 18 million was payable on completion.
That figure would be composed of about 6.75 million stg from the allotment of 2.16 million new ordinary shares, 6.0 million stg from the placing, and a further 5.25 million stg in cash.
Any further payments would depend on Bensons' profitability, Rosebys said in a statement.
The company said it expected the deal to be earnings enhancing.
Regarding its own operations, Rosebys said its sales in the first two months of the calendar year were comfortably ahead of last year's.
Rosebys reported 1996 pretax profits of 7.05 million stg, up 76 percent versus the previous year.
It raised its final dividend by 42.5 percent to 5.7p, making a 7.8p total dividend for the year.
